pr_title: [BEAM-9792] Fixing the IOException handling in InsertAll for BigQuery

timeline.bodyText: I would move this to a String constant. Also probably add a reference to here: https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/error-messages
timeline.author: chamikaramj

timeline.bodyText: Why are we performing an extra retry here ?
timeline.author: chamikaramj

replies.bodyText: I have changed it to throw the exception directly and changed the corresponding unit test.
replies.author: danielxjd

timeline.author: chamikaramj

timeline.bodyText: How do these exceptions extend both GoogleJsonResponseException and IOException ?
timeline.author: chamikaramj

replies.bodyText: GoogleJsonResponseException extends HttpResponseException and HttpResponseException extends IOException
replies.author: danielxjd
chamikaramj

timeline.bodyText: Please add a unit test for this method.
timeline.author: chamikaramj
chamikaramj

replies.bodyText: True, I have further simplified the method.
replies.author: danielxjd

timeline.bodyText: This will silently ignore the exception. Please check whether the expected exception is actually thrown like: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/java/io/google-cloud-platform/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/gcp/bigquery/BigQueryServicesImplTest.java#L316
timeline.author: ihji
ihji
timeline.diffHunk:

timeline.bodyText: Please modify the method name accordingly.
timeline.author: ihji

timeline.bodyText: What happens if getErrors returns two or more elements?
timeline.author: ihji

replies.bodyText: Only return the first element ErrorInfo. This is according to the logic and comment of getErrorInfo() from ApiErrorExtractor.
replies.author: danielxjd
